antibody.definition: protein created by the body to protect itself from a disease

anticipation.definition: expectation, a feeling of looking forward to something

contagious.definition: capable of being passed from one person to another

diagnosis.definition: specific disease or other cause of an illness

epidemic.definition: quick and widespread outbreak of a disease

float.definition: a decorated sculpture or scene in a parade

grimace.definition: facial expression that indicates pain or distaste

gunnysack.definition: bag made of burlap or similar rough cloth

Homecoming.definition: fall celebration in many American high schools and colleges that welcomes back graduates with a football game and other activities

iron lung.definition: machine that helps polio patients breathe

lugged.definition: carry a heavy thing with great effort

mucus.definition: thick, slimy liquid manufactured in the respiratory passages, especially the lungs and the throat

nourishment.definition: food and other substances that help the body grow, heal, and thrive

O.T..definition: occupational therapy, exercises and projects used to help patients recover skills for daily life

phlegm.definition: thick, slimy liquid manufactured in the respiratory passages, especially the lungs and the throat

plow.definition: to break up earth in preparation for planting

pulpit.definition: a platform in church from which the minister speaks

scored.definition: cut a line on the surface, often in preparation of cutting through

sermon.definition: a serious speech on a moral issue, often given in church

spinal tap.definition: a medical test taking fluid from around the spinal cord

vaccine.definition: medicine given to prevent catching a disease

virus.definition: a tiny creature that infects a living organism with a disease
